en: Charlie Chaplin once lost in a Charlie Chaplin look-alike contest.
A man named Moondyne Joe escaped prison so many times, that police built a special cell for him, from which he escaped as well.
Daniel Radcliffe, who played Harry Potter, was allergic to Harry Potter glasses.
Daniel Radcliffe's stunt double for the first 6 Harry Potter movies was paralyzed from an accident on set in the 7th movie.
It took Leonardo Da Vinci 10 years to paint Mona Lisa.
Leif Erikson is regarded as the first European to land in North America, nearly 500 years before Columbus.
In 1963, Albert Heineken created a beer bottle that could also be used as a brick to build sustainable housing in impoverished countries.
Sir Isaac Newton was 23 when he discovered the law of gravity.
Leo Da Vinci used to buy caged animals at the market just to set them free.
\nIn the Arabic version of The Simpsons, Homer is called\nOmar Shamshoom.
Hitler was nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize in 1939.
Madonna and Michael Jackson were both born in 1958.
Michael Jackson had a meeting at the WTC on 9/11 but overslept.
In 2012, a couple invited Queen Elizabeth II to their wedding as a joke, and she turned up.
Italian artist Piero Manzoni filled 90 tin cans with his feces, called it "Artist's sh*t" and sold them for up to €124,000 a tin.
The attachment of the human skin to muscles is what causes dimples.
During his or her lifetime, the average human will grow 590 miles of hair.
Did you know your foot and your forearm are the same length?
Hugh Jackman went through approximately 700 claws as the part of Wolverine in X-Men.
The heaviest baby weighed 23 lb, 12 oz, but did not survive birth. The heaviest baby who survived birth weighed 22 lb, 8 oz.
Jerry West was the model for the official NBA logo. His silhouette appears dribbling a basketball.
George Custer was the youngest American officer ever to become a general in the United States Army. He made his rank at age twenty-three.
Queen Elizabeth II has a rubber duck in her private bath with an inflatable crown.
Harrison Ford is the only actor whose ten highest grossing movies have each earned at least $200 million.
There are approximately 1,319,872,109 people on the Internet.
Thomas Edison, lightbulb inventor, was afraid of the dark!
Leonard da Vinci could write with one hand and draw with the other at the same time.
Michael Jordan was cut from his high school basketball team his sophomore year.
The German Kaiser Wilhelm II had a withered arm and often hid the fact by posing with his hand resting on a sword, or by holding gloves.
Paul McCartney's mother was a midwife.
Noah Webster was referred to as "the walking question mark" during his student days at Yale.
The average IQ is 100, while 140 is the beginning of genius IQ.
Leonardo da Vinci was dyslexic, and he often wrote backwards.
Howard Hughes once made half a billion dollars in one day.
Hoover, Roosevelt, Truman and Nixon's Secretaries of State have won Noble Peace Prizes.
Reportedly, Virginia Woolf wrote all her books while standing.
Oil tycoon, John D. Rockefeller, was the world's first billionaire.
William Shakespeare's wife was named Anne Hathaway.
Everyone thought Albert Einstein suffered from dyslexia, because he couldn't speak properly until he was 9 years old.
Catherine the Great relaxed by being tickled.
Lafayette's (general of USA) whole name takes up an entire line on a page: Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette.
Marco Polo was born on the Croatian island of Korcula.
Robert Peary, who left pieces of the flag scattered at the North Pole was honored for doing this.
Roger Wrenn was the photographer who took the famous picture of General Douglas MacArthur wading ashore in the Philippines in October 1944.
Did you know Einstein slept 10 hours a night?
Walt Disney's youngest daughter is named Sharon.
King George I could not speak English.
Mr. Rogers was an ordained Presbyterian minister.
The first-lady of the U.S. is considered a private citizen.
Grover Cleveland answered the White House phone personally.
Elvis Presley made only 1 television commercial.
Roseanne's fear is a fear of anyone touching your toes.
Shakespeare spelled his OWN name several different ways.
The Spanish painter Velázquez was official court painter to King Philip IV when he was twenty-six.
In 1985, Pete Rose became the first professional athlete to appear on the front of a Wheaties box.
Henry VIII's second wife, Anne Boleyn, had six fingers on one hand. She wore special gloves all her life to hide her deformity.
The famous Impressionist painter Claude Monet won 100,000 francs in the state lottery. The money made him financially independent.
Marilyn Monroe had used three different shades of red lipstick and a dark red lip liner in order to get her lips that perfectly red.
Gaetano Albert "Guy" Lombardo did the first New Year's Eve broadcast of "Auld Lang Syne," from the Roosevelt Grill in New York City in 1929/1930.
Donald F. Duncan, the man who made the yo-yo an American tradition.
Donald F. Duncan, the man who credited with popularizing the parking meter and introducing "Good Humor" ice cream on a stick.
William Shatner has the first inter-racial kiss (with Nichelle Nichols), both in episodes of Star Trek.
Charles Griggs from Missouri introduced the lemon-lime drink in 1929. Four years later he renamed it 7-Up. Sales increased significantly.
In high school, Robin Williams was voted 'Least Likely to Succeed.'
Babies can only see black and white when they are born
According to Hamburg sex researcher Dr. Werner Habermehl, women with red hair have more sex than women with other hair colors
Lilith, the supposed first wife of Adam, is said to have had red hair. She was ultimately kicked out of the Garden of Eden because she refused to be subordinate to Adam
Some scholars speculate that because Adam was from “red earth” and the Hebrew word for “red” is adom, that Adam was a redhead
Mark Twain once quipped that “while the rest of the human race are descended from monkeys, redheads derive from cats”
Famous left-handed intellectuals include Albert Einstein, Isaac Newton, Charles Darwin, and Benjamin Franklin
MythBusters host Jaime Hyneman worked on the second and third movie of The Matrix. Hyneman currently owns his own special effects company called M5 Industries.
Adam Savage from Myth Busters worked as a graphic designer, set designer, animator, and film developer. He also built models for Galaxy Quest, The Matrix Reloaded, and Space Cowboys.
Fredric Baur invented the Pringles can. When he passed away in 2008, his ashes were buried in one.
Nicki Minaj is acrophobic, meaning she is afraid of heights.
As a child, Johnny Depp was allergic to chocolate.
Chuck Norris’ first name is actually Carlos.
Frank Oz was the voice for Yoda, Miss Piggy and Cookie Monster.
Daniel Craig is the first actor to play James Bond that was born after the series began.
Susan Boyle’s Britain’s Got Talent audition has received almost 50 million views on YouTube.
Rowan Atkinson has a master’s degree in Electrical Engineering.
P!nk’s real name is Alecia Beth Moore.
Kelly Clarkson appeared as an extra on Sabrina, the Teenage Witch a couple of months before auditioning for American Idol.
Demi Moore was cross-eyed as a child and wore an eye patch until her vision was corrected after two operations.
Robert Downey Jr. claims that Burger King saved his life from his drug addiction.
Wayne Rooney was only sixteen years old when he first played for Everton.
Angelina Jolie performed her own stunts whilst filming Lara Croft: Tomb Raider.
Chris Brown has appeared on an episode of Sesame Street.
Elvis Presley was a natural blonde.
Uncle Phil from Fresh Prince of Bel-Air was also the voice of Shredder from the original Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles cartoon.
Ke$ha is terrified of ghosts.
“Mraz” means frost in Czech. Jason says he likes it because it means he is always cool.
Britney Spears loves vanilla candles.
Johnny Depp has a fear of clowns and spiders.
Orlando Bloom has a fear of pigs.
Tobey Maguire who played the character Spiderman, had a fear of heights.
Tom Hanks had an asteroid named after him which was called “12818 tomhanks”.
George Lucas originally wanted to be a race car driver, but an accident just before his high school graduation changed his mind.
Jennifer Lopez was the first actress to have a movie and an album hit number one in the same week.
Bob Dylan took his stage name from Welsh poet Dylan Thomas.
Taylor Lautner was a junior world karate champion for several years running.
Matthew McConaughey gets so turned on by food that sometimes he has to stop eating because the feeling is so overwhelming.
Justin Timberlake originally wrote the N Sync song "Gone" for Michael Jackson.
Ben stiller's brother-in-law is the actor who voices Squidward Tentacles on "Sponge Bob Squarepants.
Brad Pitt's first job was as a chicken mascot for a fast food restaurant.
Madonna was fired from Dunkin' Donuts after she squirted jelly at a customer.
Snoop Dogg is one of the voice options for TomTom GPS.
Martin Luter King, Jr. was a huge Star Trek fan.
One of Hitler's ballsier associates once told him that his short mustache was unfashionable.
Steve Jobs became a vegan because he believed the diet would eliminate the need to bathe.
Bill Murray was arrested in 1970 for trying to smuggle 10 pounds of marijuana through Chicago O'Hare International Airport.
While at school a young Bill Gates was tasked with writing the code for the program that scheduled class. Gates altered the code to put himself in a class with mostly female pupils.
Mel Blanc voice of Bugs Bunny. He got so involved in the role that he communicated like a rabbit outside the studio.
Michael Jordan makes more money from Nike than all of the Nike factory workers in Malaysia combined.
Bob Marley's dad was white. He was a White English-Jamaican marine.
Theodore Roosevelt read an average of one book per day.
Fidel Castro has appeared in two Hollywood Movies: "Holiday in Mexico", "Easy to Wed".
Forty years after walking on the moon, Buzz Aldrin made a rap song produced by Snoop Dogg called "The Rocket Experience".
Marilyn Manson's real name is Brian Hugh.
David Bowie's eye is permanently dilated because of a fight he got in when he was 15.
Lucy Liu once claimed she had sex with a ghost.
Christopher Walken worked as a lion tamer when he was 16.
Tom Hanks is related to Abraham Lincoln.
Steve Jobs relieved stress by soaking his feet in Apple's company toilets.
Jim Carrey dropped out of school when he was 16 - after that, he worked as janitor.
Nicolas Cage once bought a pet octopus - he thought it would help with his acting.
Jaleel White, aka Urkel, was also the voice for Sonic the Hedgehog.
Actor Woody Harrelson's father was a hitman (hired assassin).
Samuel L. Jackson was part of a group of students that held a group of trustees at Morehouse College hostage.
Plastic surgeons say that Tom Cruise has an asymmetrical face.
Nicolas Cage once said that he's done mushrooms with his cat
Joaquin Phoenix's parents brought him and his siblings up in the "Children of God" cult until 1978.
Matthew McConaughey is terrified of revolving doors.
Tom Hanks enrolled in seminary school to become a priest...but didn't last.
Oprah Winfrey's real name is Orpah. The letters have been rearranged for easy reading.
Tim Allen was arrested in 1978 for possession of 1.4 pounds of cocaine and spent 2 years in jail for it.
Leonardo DiCaprio was named Leonardo because his pregnant mother was looking at a Leonardo da Vinci painting in a museum in Italy when DiCaprio first kicked.

Sylvester Stallone's first movie was a porn called "Party at Kitty and Stud's".
Tim Curry was the voice for Nigel Thornberry on Nickelodeon.
Martin Lawrence was born in Germany and moved to America at the age of six..
Sean Connery wore a wig in every single James Bond movie.
Leonardo DiCaprio had a 38-pound Sulcata tortoise. He got it from North American Reptile Breeders conference.
Dolph Lundgren has a master's degree in chemical engineering and won a Fulbright Scholarship to study at MIT.
Vin Diesel's name is an anagram of "I END LIVES.
Oona Chaplin (from Game of Thrones) is the granddaughter of Charlie Chaplin.
Matthew Perry lost piece of finger in a door-shutting accident when he was very young.

Brad Pitt worked for a strip-o-gram service.
